subject: Re: [junit] Printing to a file
msgSnippet: ... Why do you think this is a JUnit issue? All processes can have their output redirected wherever you want. The details depend on your operating system.
messageBody:
bkkunam wrote:
>
>
> Hi,
>
> Whenever assert* or and JUnit test call fails or behaves
> unexpectedly, We need to dump the input/output, so that user can see
> why it failed or What happened? This should happen whether we run it
> from command line or from IDE like Eclipse. We are planning to
> schedule testing as a batch with lot of test cases, so we want
> redirect the output of the assert to a file. It's difficult to read
> from console.Can you please help us to find the solution to redirect
> the output to a file.

Why do you think this is a JUnit issue? All processes can have their
output redirected wherever you want. The details depend on your
operating system.

Example:

java -cp <whatever> junit.textui.TestRunner com.mycompany.MyTests 1>
test.output 2> test.errors
